job_title: Business Development Representative in Denver, CO
pros: Everyone from the leadership team to my teammates makes coming to work everyday so fun and motivating. The culture is the best I've ever experienced and probably ever will!
cons: Honestly, I can't really think of a downside!

pros:
The best job, simply put!

I wake up grateful daily to work for Zoom and could not be more proud to be apart of our amazing team. 

Servant Leadership in the Dictionary should have a photo of our CEO, Eric Yuan next to it
cons: Nothing! I love everything about my work

pros: Amazing culture, wonderful employees, top notch benefits, game changing product, great pay, company that encourages donating both money and time, CEO is humble, intelligent, caring, hard working, etc.
cons: honestly can't think of a single negative about working for Zoom.

review_title: Enjoying the G-Forces of this rocketship
pros:
Feeling like part of a family
Coworkers that want to lift you up
Time off is very flexible
Innovative product that continues to help us keep a competitive edge
cons: Keeping up with rapid employee growth.  Ensuring there is room for internal growth.

pros: Great company culture, people, salary. Lots of fun events.
cons: Many changes occurring frequently, a lot to learn about. Can be overwhelming. Some roles aren't very recognised in their achievements. Too much focus on the Account Executives, less on the other teams.

review_title: The best company I've ever worked for.
job_title: Senior Enterprise Account Executive in Raleigh, NC
pros:
Technology
Culture 
People
Opportunity to make money.
cons: Zoom is expanding at a hyper level. People looking for calm are not in the right place. You need to be able to adjust and deal with change in a positive manner.

review_title: Best place I have ever worked
pros: Over my entire career this has been the best place I have ever worked. Their dedication to employees and customers is bar none. Eric is the most inspiring and good hearted person you can have as a boss.
cons: You have to actually care about the work and buy in.

pros: The leadership team is hands on and helps to provide guidance and learn opportunities. The company has a very special "human" element to it--they truly care about their employees. You can feel it as an employee.
cons: As a part of a rapidly growing company, there are the usual pains of changing policies, etc

review_title: Been at the Rest (IBM, Cisco, HP) - Now at the Best! Cloud and Software-Defined is the future
pros: Getting to work with a great solution set and smart people that care!
cons: As with all rapidly growing companies, a few growing pains here and there.

pros:
We work with and hold dear our values, we care. 

We have a great culture, fantastic people, open management. 

There’s huge scope to do what you do best, to develop your skills, work on new and exciting projects... it’s awesome.
cons: I seriously can’t think of any negative aspects working at Zoom.

job_title: Senior Account Executive in New York, NY
pros: Great Sales Tools, Great Engineers, Great Platform ie the best SAAS video communication platform built, amazing network elasticity built with mobile first, Leadership Team is step and step with the customers, sellers, buyers and they listen.
cons: This company is doing all the right things!  Amazing culture!

job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Overland Park, KS
pros: sense of community, best work environment, team work, Happiness is real
cons: If you are not prepared for a company that follows through on its core values, and is progressive, and fast paced, Zoom may not be a good fit.

job_title: Senior Account Executive in San Jose, CA
pros:
The culture here is amazing
We have an amazing product, which makes selling it even easier
The executive team is extremely approachable and willing to help anyone of their employees
Lunch is available 3x a week
cons: Still technically a start up, and there are some growing pains

pros: The culture at Zoom lives up to the hype. Great employees, flat org structure, executive transparency, and great benefits make Zoom an awesome place to work.
cons: The company is growing very fast and it has been hard to keep up with new employees. Growing pains aren't always bad though.

review_title: Best company I've ever worked for in 20+ years
pros: Competitive pay, best product in the industry, lots of leads, great culture. Eric is the best leader I have ever worked for and been around
cons: I wish I would have started working here sooner

job_title: Customer Success Manager in Denver, CO
pros:
Management/Executives truly care
Benefits are a plus
Products/software is consistently improving
cons: I don’t think this is a con if you can keep up but it’s a very face pace environment and reminds me of a startup at time.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in San Jose, CA
pros: So much room for growth and all of the executives really make an effort to get to know you. Everyone is truly happy here because Eric makes sure everyone has exactly what they need to succeed!
cons: Still some kinks that need to be smoothed over but we are learning!

review_title: The culture in the Australian office doesn't reflect the CEO and his values
pros: Great product, great office location. some employees see great flexibility
cons: Zero sales strategy. Terrible local marketing resulting in no inbound leads. The Sales experience is very panicked.

review_title: A Fantastic Company with Incredible Leadership
job_title: Senior Auditor in San Jose, CA
pros: Zoom has incredible corporate culture and tone at the top. Employees at the company believe in the mission to create happiness and that is clear from the top down.
cons: Zoom is growing very quickly which results in a lot of work for employees. Despite this, employees are motivated and hard-working.

pros:
Flexible work environment. Transparent leadership. Intelligent colleagues. Unbeatable product. Interesting and rewarding work. 

I've worked at multiple public companies and NOTHING has come close to beating the culture and product of Zoom.
cons: None, that I can think of at this time.

review_title: Zoom is a great company to work for
job_title: Technical Support Engineer in Overland Park, KS
pros: The people, environment, catered lunches 4 days a week, bonuses for working weekends and holidays and quarterly.  They really do push deliver happiness and it starts within the company.  They ensure they have happy employees that want happy customers.
cons: None that I can think of!

pros: Passionate people and more importantly, passionate customers.  Very exciting play a part in the workplace of the future.
cons: Startup culture can be exhausting (but still exciting)

pros: Zoom has by far the best product I've ever sold and it makes coming to work awesome.
cons: Sales has ups and downs no matter what company you are at.  Even in down times, Zoom is awesome and I want to come to work to get better.

review_title: Leaders are laser focused on the right stuff - customer happiness

cons: Too much love towards the company LOL, so many customers all the time!
